alert.note: Alert for Carolina; Catano; Dorado; Guaynabo; San Juan; Toa Alta; Toa Baja (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 18 at 4:38PM ADT until September 18 at 9:30PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Juan has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Carolina County in Puerto Rico... Catano County in Puerto Rico... Dorado County in Puerto Rico... Guaynabo County in Puerto Rico... San Juan County in Puerto Rico... Toa Alta County in Puerto Rico... Toa Baja County in Puerto Rico... * Until 830 PM AST. * At 338 PM AST, gauge reports indicate a hurricane rainband producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 1.5 inches per hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Areas along the Rio de la Plata in these municipalities could soon be flooded including Highway 861 near del Madril and also Barrio Pinal Puente. Highways 693 and 842 could also be rendered impassable as well as Highway 824 at Puente Los Cocos. In Dorado Highway 2 could flood when Rio Lajas goes out of its banks. Barrio Chorro de Maguayo is in danger of flooding. Flooding in Urb. Bella Vista and Jardines de Caparra. Serious flooding affecting structural integrity of bridges. Potential Landslides throughout vicinity but especially along Highways 812, 816, 8829, 830, 174 and 167. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-1.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. If you are near the named rivers please move to higher ground.

area.areaDesc: Carolina; Catano; Dorado; Guaynabo; San Juan; Toa Alta; Toa Baja
